definitions.definition: A car with automatic transmission.
definitions.example: I never learned to drive a stick. I can only drive an automatic.

definitions.definition: A semi-automatic pistol.
definitions.example: The G-men raiding the speakeasy were equipped with .45 automatics, while the local policemen were carrying revolvers and shotguns.

definitions.definition: (history) A type of early modern sword that has a broad double-edged blade for cutting (as opposed to the more slender thrust-oriented rapier) and a basket hilt.
A person armed with such a sword.
Any type of sword that is comparatively long; depending on context, applied to swords of the Bronze Age, Migration period, Viking Age and Renaissance era.
A European sword with a long, straight double-edged blade, a cruciform hilt, and a grip for two-handed use; prevalent from the 14th to 16th centuries.
(film genre) A genre of exploitation films of the 1970s that starred black actors.
In an inconsistent manner.

The position of a person or team in a tournament or competition who draws no opponent in a particular round so advances to the next round unopposed, or is awarded points for a win in a league table; also the phantom opponent of such a person or team.
definitions.example: Craig's Crew plays the bye next week.

definitions.definition: An extra scored when the batsmen take runs after the ball has passed the striker without hitting either the bat or the batsman.
A dwelling.
A thing not directly aimed at; something which is a secondary object of regard; an object by the way, etc.
A pass.
A color print produced by chromolithography.
A prostitute.
Of or relating to the chromodomain, a protein structural domain associated with chromatin production
In a blank manner, especially showing no emotion or expression.
Distinctive atmosphere or quality associated with something.
An invisible force surrounding a living creature.
Perceptual disturbance experienced by some migraine sufferers before a migraine headache.
Telltale sensation experienced by some people with epilepsy before a seizure.
A long-drawn, high-pitched complaining cry or sound
A complaint or criticism
A stand with three short legs, especially for cooking over a fire.
A stand, sometimes with short, stumpy feet, used to support hot dishes and protect a table; a hot coaster
A weaver's knife. See trevat.
A fire in which bones are burned.
A fire to burn unwanted or disreputable items or people: proscribed books, heretics etc.
A large, controlled outdoor fire, as a signal or to celebrate something.
An endowment for the maintenance of a priest to sing a daily mass for the souls of specified people
A chapel set up for this purpose
An alternate or secondary character.
An alternate account.
An alternative investment or alternative fund.
definitions.example: liquid alts

definitions.definition: The absolute height of a location, usually measured from sea level.
definitions.example: As the altitude increases, the temperature gets lower, so remember to bring warm clothes to the mountains.

definitions.definition: A vertical distance.
The distance measured perpendicularly from a figure's vertex to the opposite side of the vertex.
definitions.example: The perpendicular height of a triangle is known as its altitude.

definitions.definition: The angular distance of a heavenly body above our Earth's horizon.
Height of rank or excellence; superiority.
(in the plural) Elevation of spirits; heroics; haughty airs.
Highest point or degree.
The hobby of collecting paper documents, particularly business stock certificates.
To make spiritual; to invoke spirituality.
To refine intellectually or morally; to purify from the corrupting influence of the world; to give a spiritual character or tendency to.
To give a spiritual meaning to; to take in a spiritual sense; opposed to literalize.
To extract spirit.
To convert into, or impregnate with, spirit.
(of lines or paths) To run apart; to separate; to tend into different directions.
(of interests, opinions, or anything else) To become different; to run apart; to separate; to tend into different directions.
definitions.example: Both stories start out the same way, but they diverge halfway through.

definitions.definition: (of a line or path) To separate, to tend into a different direction (from another line or path).
definitions.example: The sidewalk runs next to the street for a few miles, then diverges from it and turns north.

definitions.definition: (of an interest, opinion, or anything else) To become different, to separate (from another line or path).
definitions.example: The software is pretty good, except for a few cases where its behavior diverges from user expectations.

definitions.definition: (of a sequence, series, or function) Not to converge: to have no limit, or no finite limit.
Without any clouds.
A submergent coastal landform, often known as a drowned river valley
A large fire extending to many objects, or over a large space; a general burning.
definitions.example: It took sixty firefighters to put out the conflagration.

definitions.definition: A large-scale conflict.
A person who is skilled at, or practices, endocrinology.
(usually uncountable) A flavored, creamy sugar preparation, used for icing cakes or as a base for candies.
A candy filled with such a preparation.
A sugar dough, usually prepared as large sheets (rolled fondant), used in place of icing to cover large areas of cakes, composed of sugar, water, gelatin, glycerine.
(usually uncountable) Fondue.
definitions.example: fondant cheese

definitions.definition: (usually uncountable) The base or flux, in enamel, which is colored throughout by metallic oxide while in a state of fusion.
Stooping, as for prey: said of an eagle, a falcon, etc.
A type of harp played in West Africa.
To move on skis
To travel over (a slope etc.) on skis; to travel on skis at (a place), (especially as a sport)
To hit, kick or throw (a ball) extremely high.
To clear (a hurdle, high jump bar, etc.) by a large margin.
To hang (a picture on exhibition) near the top of a wall, where it cannot be well seen.
To drink something from a container without one's lips touching the container.
To depose; to forcibly relieve a monarch of the monarchy.
To remove any governing authority from power.
To remove from any position of high status or power.
To remove (something) from a position of power or paramount importance.
A breathing.
An aspirate.
Any spirituous preparation.
The ability to shoot accurately at a target.
A circuit board that connects several connectors in parallel to each other, so that each pin of each connector is linked to the same relative pin of all the other connectors, forming a computer bus.
The mark of the foot left on the earth.
(by extension) A faint mark or visible sign left by something which is lost, or has perished, or is no longer present.
definitions.example: the vestiges of ancient magnificence in Palmyra

definitions.definition: A vestigial organ; a non-functional organ or body part that was once functional in an evolutionary ancestor.
Not having (noticeable) seeds.
definitions.example: What do you plant to grow seedless grapes? Actually, they have seeds, but they are quite edible by humans.

definitions.definition: A cardigan.
The inflammation of arterial walls, often due to infection or an autoimmune response.
To put shoes on one's feet.
To put horseshoes on a horse.
To equip an object with a protection against wear.
definitions.example: The billiard cue stick was shod in silver.

definitions.definition: The act of fitting an animal with horseshoes.
A thrashing.
The state of being cheerful; joy.
The time of day when a person has, or is given, a bath.
The tendency to think selfishly with exclusive self-interest in mind.
The belief that moral behavior should be directed toward one's self-interest only.
(by confusion of the similar words) Egotism.
A sudden, violent event.
A sudden and violent change in the earth's crust.
A great flood.
Stressed, rushed, panicked, overly busy or preoccupied.
definitions.example: The entire place teemed with harried executives who had no time to talk to one another.

definitions.definition: Harassed.
To plunder, pillage, assault.
To make repeated attacks on an enemy.
To strip, lay waste, ravage.
To harass, bother or distress with demands, threats, or criticism.
To drive away, disperse.
To use up or waste; squander.
To vanish by dispersion.
To cause energy to be lost through its conversion to heat.
To be dissolute in conduct.
Any mechanical device used to position something
The part of a control valve used to control the opening or closing of the actuator based on electric, or pneumatic signals
(rural) A piglet.
An athlete who spends a year not participating in official athletic activities, but does not lose his or her eligibility to participate in following years
An unimportant character introduced only to be killed in order to underscore the peril to the important characters; an expendable character.
definitions.example: Sensing danger, Captain Kirk decided to beam down to the surface with Spock, McCoy, and a couple of redshirts.

definitions.definition: A person responsible for loading and unloading weapons, artillery, and equipment from aircraft.
To place an athlete in a status wherein the athlete will spend a year not participating in official athletic activities, but will not lose his or her eligibility to participate in following years.
definitions.example: The university decided to redshirt the freshman linebacker to give him an extra year to build up his bulk.

definitions.definition: To take on a status wherein one will spend a year not participating in official athletic activities.
To hold a child out of kindergarten for one year in the hope that the child will do better academically and socially.
To identify or locate precisely or with great accuracy.
definitions.example: The investigators tried to pinpoint the source of the flames.

definitions.definition: A mechanical linkage based on parallelograms causing two objects to move in parallel; notably as a drawing aid.
definitions.example: A pantograph can be adjusted to make either scaled or exact copies.

definitions.definition: By extension, a structure of crosswise bars linked in such a way that it can extend and compress like an accordion, such as in a pantograph mirror or a scissor lift.
A pattern printed on a document to reduce the ease of photocopying.
definitions.example: I was impressed by the quality of the pantograph; I hadn't noticed it on the original, but the copies were covered in unpleasant lines.

definitions.definition: A similarly-formed conductive device, now usually Z-shaped, that collects electric current from overhead lines for trains and trams.
A Classical comic actor, especially one who works mainly through gesture and mime.
The drama in ancient Greece and Rome featuring such performers; or (later) any of various kinds of performance modelled on such work.

A traditional theatrical entertainment, originally based on the commedia dell'arte, but later aimed mostly at children and involving physical comedy, topical jokes, call and response, and fairy-tale plots.
Gesturing without speaking; dumb-show, mime.
Without a (living) father.
Without a known author or inventor.
The process of becoming, or the state of being, acclimated, or habituated to a new climate; acclimatization.
The adaptation of an organism to its natural climatic environment.
One who sees something; an eyewitness.
One who foretells the future; a clairvoyant, prophet, soothsayer or diviner.
Unit of mass or volume in the Middle East and Indian subcontinent.
Any of various large, venomous rays, of the orders Rajiformes and Myliobatiformes, having a barbed, whiplike tail.
A device that simulates a cell tower, used to intercept cell phone communications.
An inventory of items that are currently stocked.
(game of go) Bonus points given to the white player to compensate for the fact that black plays first.
A one-piece article of lingerie, resembling stockings or pantyhose but covering the torso, legs and sometimes the arms.
definitions.example: Bodystockings may be worn by as undergarments by exotic dancers.

definitions.definition: A fatty layer of adipose tissue found immediately beneath the epidermis.
Fatty tissue.
The thick coat of fat worn by many Arctic animals, such as sea lions, and Antarctic animals, such as penguins; used to insulate warmth in the animal's body.
A bubble.
To make noises or broken words while crying.
To swell or disfigure (the face) with weeping; to wet with tears.
To make quiet; to calm; to reduce to a state of peace; to dispel (anger or hatred).
definitions.example: to appease the tumult of the ocean

definitions.definition: To come to terms with; to adapt to the demands of.
definitions.example: They appeased the angry gods with burnt offerings.

definitions.definition: A decorative border around a picture used to inset and center the contents of a frame.
definitions.example: The image is a perfect square of 8 cm (with white matte border the total dimensions are 14 cm tall by 11 cm wide).

definitions.definition: A background, often painted or created with computers
definitions.example: Matte painting is a tool that filmmakers can use to create a scene that is impossible to achieve with conventional cinematographic means.

definitions.definition: (pyrometallurgy) The molten metal sulfide phases typically formed during smelting of copper, nickel, and other base metals.
To daub or cover with gum.
A high-ranking Muslim woman, especially in India and Pakistan
The form of address for such a woman
An establishment with sunbeds in it or where one can rent sunbeds.
A room, with many windows, exposed to the sun.
A sundial.
To fondle, kid, pet, tease.
To wheedle, persuade (a person, organisation, animal etc.) gradually or by use of flattery to do something.
definitions.example: He coaxed the horse gently into the trailer.

definitions.definition: To carefully manipulate into a particular desired state, situation or position.
definitions.example: They coaxed the rope through the pipe.

definitions.definition: A pageant; a colourful show or display, as in a pageant.
One who destroys religious images or icons, especially an opponent of the Orthodox Church in the 8th and 9th centuries, or a Puritan during the European Reformation.
One who opposes orthodoxy and religion; one who adheres to the doctrine of iconoclasm.
(by extension) One who attacks cherished beliefs.
Inequality in marriage; marriage with an inferior.
To match unequally; to degrade or dishonor.
To dishonor by a comparison with what is inferior; to lower in rank or estimation by actions or words; to speak slightingly of; to depreciate; to undervalue.
To ridicule, mock, discredit.
Forbidden, prohibited.
Any of several trees, of the genus Jacaranda, native to tropical South America, that have pale purple, funnel-shaped flowers.
The hard, dark wood of these trees.
A trade name for similar hardwood timber from certain species of Dalbergia, notably Dalbergia frutescens, Dalbergia nigra and Dalbergia refusa.
To make the sound of a chime.
definitions.example: I got up for lunch as soon as the wall clock began chiming noon.

definitions.definition: To cause to sound in harmony; to play a tune, as upon a set of bells; to move or strike in harmony.
To utter harmoniously; to recite rhythmically.
To agree; to correspond.
definitions.example: The other lab's results chimed with mine, so I knew we were on the right track with the research.

definitions.definition: To make a rude correspondence of sounds; to jingle, as in rhyming.
An author who collaborates with another to write something.
To write something in collaboration with another author.
A canal on the central plain of Thailand.
Study of set or fixed expressions.
The style in which words and phrases are used in writing or speech.
A group of specialized words and expressions used by a particular group.
A collection of phrases; a phrasebook.
The square board used in the game of chess, subdivided into eight rows of eight squares each, the squares in each row and column being of alternating colours.
A mathematical construction based on this pattern of squares
A geometric shape with four angles and four straight sides; a four-sided polygon.
A courtyard which is quadrangular.
The buildings forming the border of such a courtyard.
A tract of soft, wet ground; a marsh; a fen.
Anything that entraps or makes progress difficult.
To paint anew or again, especially if recently painted.

definitions.definition: To draw or render again on the display.
The act of painting something again.
Of or relating to kinesthesia.
The sound made by a hen, especially when brooding, or calling her chicks.
Any sound similar to this.
A kind of tongue click used to urge on a horse.
To make such a sound.
To cause (the tongue) to make a clicking sound.

definitions.definition: To call together, or call to follow, as a hen does her chickens.
To suffer withdrawal from heroin.
(German mythology) An ambivalent, sometimes vindictive, spirit that is capable of materialising as an object or human, often a child; a sprite.
(German folklore) A mischievous elf or goblin, or one connected (and helpful) to a family or household.
(fantasy literature) One of a diminutive and usually malevolent race of beings.
To correct.
definitions.example: Righting all the wrongs of the war immediately will be impossible.

definitions.definition: To set upright.
definitions.example: The tow-truck righted what was left of the automobile.

definitions.definition: To return to normal upright position.
definitions.example: When the wind died down, the ship righted.

definitions.definition: To do justice to; to relieve from wrong; to restore rights to; to assert or regain the rights of.
definitions.example: to right the oppressed

definitions.definition: The act of putting something right.
definitions.example: the rightings of social wrongs

definitions.definition: Wood grown or felled for use as commercial fuel
Any of three semistable mesons, having positive, negative or neutral charge, composed of up and down quarks/antiquarks.
A little finger, the finger furthest on a hand from the thumb.
(less commonly) A little toe, the toe furthest on a foot from the big toe.
Methylated spirits mixed with red wine or Condy's crystals.
A baby mouse, especially when used as food for a snake, etc.
A white person.
The Australasian snapper or pink snapper (Chrysophrys auratus).
The smallest finger or toe of a hand or foot.
(South Australia) A bilby.
A short spoon.
A short tobacco pipe.
A wanton or unchaste woman.
A girl with a short, dumpy figure.
Short, shortened, or small; curtailed.
The act of breaking up; disintegration or division.
The termination of a friendship, or a romantic relationship.
A loss of emotional control; a breakdown.

Condom

The act of one who rampages.

To walk with long steps.

definitions.definition: Wit, cleverness, cognitive abilities.

To use the toilet
To assist another (a child etc.) in using the toilet

A Southeast Asian carnivorous plant of the genus Nepenthes; a monkey cup or tropical pitcher plant.
A drug mentioned in Homer's Odyssey (c. 8th century B.C.E.) as bringing relief from anxiety or grief; hence, any drug or substance seen as bringing welcome forgetfulness or relief.
A Southeast Asian carnivorous plant of the genus Nepenthes; a monkey cup or tropical pitcher plant.
A device used to stir.

definitions.definition: A person who stirs something.

definitions.definition: A person who spreads rumours or causes agitation.

definitions.definition: One who stirs or moves about, as after sleep.
Relating to, resembling, or producing tubers
Relating to tuberosities
Of or pertaining to calligraphy.
Written in an artistic style or manner, as calligraphy.
To fit with panels.
The panels with which a surface (especially an indoor wall) is covered, considered collectively.
A heavy or helpless collapse; a slouching or drooping posture; a period of poor activity or performance, especially an extended period.

The gross amount; the mass; the lump.
